classFeature.name: Doggo Sidekick
entries: A unique sidekick class to represent only the bestest of traveling companions.

entries.name: Prerequisite:
entries: Is a doggo, or considered one by their companions.

classFeature.name: Helpful
entries: Starting at first level, the doggo is adept at giving well-timed assistance; the doggo can take the {@action Help} action as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Expert Pack Tactics
entries: Starting at 2nd level, the doggo has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the doggo's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}. If the doggo already had pack tactics, its pack tactics improve and whenever it has advantage on an attack roll from pack tactics, it can reroll one of the dice once.
Additionally, the doggo can pass through the space of allied creatures without expending additional movement.

classFeature.name: Adventuring Helper
entries: Starting at 3rd level, the doggo gains exceptional awareness and cleverness when using the tools of its pack. Its intelligence score increases by 2 to a maximum of 20, and it can count its mouth as a free hand for the purposes of using and administering potions, healing kits, etc.
It gains proficiency in light and medium armor (though can only wear barding made to fit it), simply melee weapons, and one tool of its choice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Master Pack Tactics
entries: Starting at 6th level, the first time the doggo rolls damage on an attack that gains advantage from Pack Tactics, it deals an additional {@dice 2d6} damage. It can forgo this damage to force the target to make a Strength saving throw with a DC 8 + its Strength modifier + proficiency bonus or be knocked {@condition prone}.
At 15th level, this damage increases to {@dice 4d6} at 15th level.

classFeature.name: Counterbark
entries: At 7th level, you gain the ability to use ferocious barks to disrupt mind-influencing effects. As a reaction to any creature within 30 feet of you making a saving throw against being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}, you can bark loudly bringing to them back to their senses giving all creatures within 30 feet {@footnote advantage|This word was omitted, probably as a typo, and is re-added by the converter.} on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} until the start of your next turn. A creature must be able to hear you to gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Dauntless Packmate
entries: Starting at 1th level, the first time it would drop to 0 hit points, it instead drops to 1, and then regains {@dice 1d6} hit points for each allied creature within 60 feet of it, up to a maximum number of {@dice d6} equal to its proficiency bonus. Once it uses this feature, it cannot use it again until it completes a short or long rest.
Additionally, the doggo immune to the {@condition frightened} condition while an allied creature it can see or hear is within 60 feet to act brave in front of.

classFeature.name: Ever Alert
entries: Starting at 14th level, the doggo can no longer be surprised, even while sleeping. It gains a +5 bonus to initiative rules, and other creatures cannot gain advantage against it as a result of being unseen by it. It can still make {@skill Perception} checks and use passive {@skill Perception} while sleeping, though it suffers disadvantage on them.

classFeature.name: Bounding Run
entries: Starting at 18th level, the doggo's movement increases by 20 feet, and the distance it can jump with a running start is doubled. Its movement is not impeded by difficult terrain when moving toward an ally.

classFeature.name: Back from the Farm
entries: Starting at 20th level, if a doggo ever dies, it mysteriously returns {@dice 1d4} days later in good health and spirits.
